sentences: John seized the comic from Bill. He had read it every summer and had never really wanted to work in comics.
John seized the comic from Bill. He wanted to make sure he had taken over.

John seized the comic from Bill. He wasn't happy about it, but he still made the joke that Bill had been too hard on him and that there were many more people out there who had found something of that sort to make in him.
John seized the comic from Bill. He was on the verge of losing his job and would be making several thousand dollars a day.
John seized the comic from Bill. He couldn't do it.
John passed the comic to Bill. He's like, "You're a great writer, but I don't think you're a great actor.
John passed the comic to Bill. He went and wrote it down and left it in his bed so he wasn't supposed to get it back.
John passed the comic to Bill. He was the first to write a comic book for his son Bill with the intention of making it up to a friend of mine (which isn't to say that he didn't like it at first).
John passed the comic to Bill. He put out a book of drawings of it.
John passed the comic to Bill. He told him that he had read the book, and wanted to take it for himself.
